issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: TestRMFailover#testAutomaticFailover always passes even when it should fail

Thanks for the fix, [~yufeigu]! Can we extract a new method that does the checking instead of having two copies? Otherwise, it looks good to me.
Thanks [~haibochen] for the review. Uploaded patch v2 for your comment.

This message was automatically generated.

Thanks for the update, [~yufeigu]! One question that I was missing is, do you think sleep(1) is long enough? If we have hit this bug quite a lot, it probably means we are not sleeping long enough. An internal of 1 ms seems too short to me. Maybe we should try sleep(100)?

No, we don't hit the bug a lot. Flakiness is possible because of sleeping too short. Tested more than 50 times, no related failures. But I agree with you that 2000 * 1 = 2000 ms waiting time may be too short. I will increase it to 20s in next patch.

I'm not a fan of wonky _for_ statements.  Wanna replace that _for-if_ with a _while_ and a decrement?
Thanks [~templedf] for the review. Uploaded patch v5 for your comment.
Works for me.  +1  I'll commit soon.
